context: The Finnish word 'kohti' is a postposition that indicates direction or destination. It generally translates to 'towards', 'to', or 'at' in English. It takes the partitive case as an argument, meaning the noun following it will be in the partitive form. For example, 'kotia kohti' means 'towards home'. The word can also mean 'per' when used with time units, like 'päivää kohti' which translates to 'per day'.
